This is not a fatal JVM defect. In fact, it looks like it isn't a JVM
defect, but bug in the Linux glibc/pthread libraries. It only affects
the results of System.exit, so it's not even a fatal bug for JUnit. The
*only* thing that doesn't work is the exit codes.

Since the the two failures reported in:

http://www.egroups.com/message/junit/257

are identical to those in:

http://www.egroups.com/message/junit/108

I took the leap of assuming they are caused by the same underlying
problem. The bug was initially claimed to be in libc.so 2.2, but not in
2.1.2 which is the default RedHat libc so I could be wrong. Later data
(January 10 of this year) suggests that libpthread-0.9 is the culprit.

The JVM defect was discussed in:

http://www.egroups.com/message/junit/113

and is listed at Sun:

http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4388732.html

Regards,

Rob
